TaskDescription.Detail: Search the exchange rate of won and yen on Google.

Assist.value: Launch the Chrome browser and go to the Google page.
Activate to use headless mode.
Enter 'google.com', a site to view exchange rates.
Enter 'exchange rate' in the search field.
Specify the search box.
Enter 'exchange rate' as the text to be entered.
Activate it to enter 'Enter' when text input is complete.
Change the country for exchange rate to Korea.
Designate the country combo box above among the countries displayed in the exchange rate.
Enter the text 'South Korean won' of the content to select in the combo box.
Change the target country of exchange rate to Japan.
Select the country combo box below among the countries displayed in the exchange rate.
Enter the text 'Japanese Yen' for the selection in the combo box.
Wait for 1 second for the change to be reflected on the screen.
Enter the result of the search exchange rate into the variable.
Specifies that two texts displayed as a result of the exchange rate lookup are selected. (Example: '1 Korean Won =', '0.1 Japanese Yen')
Enter the variable 'this.exchange' to store the specified objects as a list type.
The exchange rate result is output to the message box.
Enter 'this.exchange[0] + this.exchange[1]' using a variable in which the two data, the result of the exchange rate, are stored in a list format.
Quit your browser.
Enter the browser you want to quit. Enter 'LATEST_BROWSER' to close the browser most recently controlled through the scenario.
